YUSU have announced that they will be reversing the decision made last year to rebrand Freshers Week as Welcome Week

The NUS has attacked David Lammy MP, Minister for Innovation, Universities and Skills, following a decision which they believe will leave poorer students short of funds.

Enquiry into bus passenger eliminated

An enquiry into the identity of a bus passenger who boarded a Coastliner bus at 5.39am on the morning of Claudia Lawrence's disappearance has been eliminated.

Scheduled gas works to be carried out throughout York will cause disruption along University Road throughout September and possibly the start of October (Thumbnail credit Image from Google Streetview)

YUSU release new ruddy shelducks

Tuesday saw YUSU President Tom Scott fulfil last year's UGM motion to replace "Golden Duck" Trevor with a pair of ruddy shelducks. (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: George Lowther)

"Being small maintains us as the best. The intention is not to get big, but sustainable"

Brian Cantor is confident. Confident in the University, its future, and his own leadership. And as he assuredly explains how York is set to go from strength to strength, it is hard not to agree.

Contention has arisen between JCRs and YUSU after it has emerged that colleges have been acting illegally by giving away free alcohol at events.

Last Saturday Vanbrugh Paradise was host to RAG's annual Woodstock event.

The Economics Department has released revised marks for its Microeconomics 2 examination following strong student dissatisfaction with the marking procedure.

University welfare provision criticised

University officials have admitted that the welfare provision for students with eating disorders is inadequate.

YUSU has submitted a paper on students' behalf to the University calling for the current term dates to be altered.

Leaked YUSU and Campus Services recycling figures have identified shortcomings by colleges in ensuring waste is recycled at an acceptable rate.

The Halifax College Student Association has adopted a new constitution

A new barbeque built in Donald Barron Court was vandalised last weekend.

B Henry's looks set to have its future confirmed for the first time in over 10 years with University officials set to confirm an increase in opening hours, Nouse understands.

Lewis Bretts, Democracy and Services Officer-elect, has denied that he plans to implement the censorship of online media archives, despite strongly voicing the idea.
